Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures a comment for the Business Process.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.

Event_Classification_SubcategoryObjectID.type: WID,  Benefits_Event_Subcategory_ID,  Change_Job_Subcategory_ID,  End_Additional_Job_Subcategory_ID,  Event_Classification_Subcategory_ID,  General_Event_Subcategory_ID,  Leave_of_Absence_Type_ID,  Termination_Subcategory_ID,  Undo_Move_Subcategory_ID

Manage_Job_Requisition_Freeze_Data.description: Reference to the reason the job requisition is being frozen/unfrozen.
The Job Requisition Manage Freeze Date is the date the job requisition will be frozen/unfrozen.
Set to true to freeze the job requisition, false to unfreeze.

Business_Sub_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.
When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically skipped (if it is defined as "skippable" within the business process definition).

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

Manage_Job_Requisition_Freeze_Data.description: Run the Update Job Posting sub business process to unpost the job postings associated with this Job Requisition. To use, Unpost Job must be enabled in the workflow definition for Edit Job Requisition.

validation.validation: You cannot initiate Unpost Job because there are other pending actions for a job posting that conflict with this one. Close the pending actions listed below before initiating the new action.

Job_Posting_Site_Data.description: A unique identifier to reference a Job Posting.
Name of the Job Posting Site. Specify the Job Posting Site by entering data here or in the Job Posting Site Reference.

Job_Posting_SiteObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Job_Posting_SiteObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Job_Posting_SiteObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Job_Posting_Site_Data.description: Reference to the Job Posting Site. Specify the Job Posting Site by entering data here or entering the Job Posting Site Name.

validation.validation: Another Job Posting exists for the specified date range. Please update the existing posting or select a different date range.
validation.description: Another Job Posting exists for the specified date range. Please update the existing posting or select a different date range.

validation.validation: You cannot select this Job Posting Site because the Recruiting Agency is either inactive or has a location restriction that does not meet the job requisition primary location.
validation.description: Invalid agency posting site, please ensure the agency is active and/or update the agency location restrictions to match the job requisition to initiate this action.

validation.validation: You can't post this requisition to this recruiting agency because this recruiting agency doesn't support confidential job postings. Use the Edit Recruiting Agency task to enable confidential job postings for this recruiting agency.
validation.description: You can't post this requisition to this recruiting agency because this recruiting agency doesn't support confidential job postings. Use the Edit Recruiting Agency task to enable confidential job postings for this recruiting agency.

Job_Posting_Site_Data.description: Start date of the job posting. Must be after today.

validation.validation: Job Posting Start Date must be on or after Recruiting Start Date.
validation.description: Job Posting Start Date must be on or after Recruiting Start Date.

validation.validation: Select a start date that's on or after the current date of the primary location for the job requisition: [date]
validation.description: Select a start date that's on or after the current date of the primary location for the job requisition.

Job_Posting_Site_Data.description: End date of the Job Posting.
Job posting is the default job posting used for social share and invite to apply referrals. Will return false until post job business process is complete.
The Forecasted Agency Payout on a Job Posting. Calculated at time of posting or updated later. The Currency for this value is stored separately on the Job Posting.

CurrencyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CurrencyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CurrencyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Job_Posting_Site_Data.description: The Currency for the Forecasted Agency Payout stored on the Job Posting.

Post_Job_Sub_Business_Process.description: Wrapper for the data for each Job Posting.

validation.validation: No Job Posting Site exists with the provided Job Posting Site Name.
validation.description: A Job Posting Site Name was entered, but there are no Job Posting Sites in the current tenant with the specified name.

validation.validation: Select another Job Posting Site because only an External Career Site can be designated as the Primary Posting.
validation.description: Select another Job Posting Site because only an External Career Site can be designated as the Primary Posting.

validation.validation: A Job Posting to site [job posting site] has dates that overlap with 1 or more Job Postings for the same job.
validation.description: A Job Posting has dates that overlap with 1 or more Job Postings for the same site.

validation.validation: Enter an End Date that is after the Start Date.
validation.description: Enter an End Date that is after the Start Date.

validation.validation: Specify both a Forecasted Payment Amount and Currency for recruiting agency job postings.
You can't add Forecasted Payout Amount or Currency to job postings for sites other than agency sites.

Manage_Job_Requisition_Freeze_Data.description: Run the Post Job Sub Business Process to post this job requisition to one or more Job Posting Sites. To use, Post Job must be enabled in the Workflow Definition for Create Job Requisition.

validation.validation: Only one Job Posting Site can set as the Primary Posting for the Job Requisition.

description: Wrapper element for the freezing/unfreezing of a job requisition.

validation.validation: The freeze/unfreeze date cannot be earlier than the recruiting start date.
The requested job requisition is filled.
There are completed or in progress close events for this job requisition.
The job requisition cannot be edited as there are existing pending action events for the job requisition.
No change has been made to the freeze status of the job requisition.
Enter a date that is after [futureDate], the date this job requisition is frozen or unfrozen.
